Hey there!

I'm an AI student and trying to set up Jason Gauci's HyperNEAT =
c++
(version 2.6).  However, I'm kinda new to c++ and building libraries an=
d
hence having trouble setting it up.

The short version is that, when i tr=
y to build hyperneat in visual
studio 2010, I repeatedly get these error me=
ssages


1>C:\Documents and
Settings\Ruben\Bureaublad\minimaster\HyperNEAT_=
v2_6\HyperNEAT\NEAT\inclu\
de\NEAT_GeneticIndividual.h(68): error C2872: 's=
hared_ptr' : ambiguous
symbol
1>          could be 'C:\Documents and
Settin=
gs\Ruben\Bureaublad\minimaster\libs\boost_1_45_0\boost/smart_ptr/s\
hared_p=
tr.hpp(169) : boost::shared_ptr'
1>          or       'C:\Program Files\Mic=
rosoft Visual Studio
10.0\VC\include\memory(1418) : std::tr1::shared_ptr'

=
Does anyone have any idea what could cause this?


Now for the longer versi=
on:
I'm using windows xp 32 bit, visual studio 2010.
The directories look l=
ike this:

minimaster/libs/boost_1_45_0
minimaster/libs/openmpi-1.4.3-   (y=
es, with a - at the end)

minimaster\HyperNEAT_v2_6\zlib
minimaster\HyperNE=
AT_v2_6\JGTL
minimaster\HyperNEAT_v2_6\tinyxmldll
minimaster\HyperNEAT_v2_6=
\HyperNEAT

For each of these folders I made a build file using cmake 2.8.3=
 in the
folder/build (configuring the right paths) and then opened this bui=
ld
file in visual studio 2010 to build the solution.

Except for the boost =
library. I used bjam to build using the following
command

bjam --build-dir=
=3Dbuild-directory toolset=3Dtoolset-name
--build-type=3Dcomplete stagewith=
 a certain build directory, toolset was
msvc. However, the build directory =
was not created and if I tried to
build it in an existing folder it remains=
 empty. The output of bjam can
be found here as txt
<http://www.student.vu.=
nl/%7Erbk600/hyperneat/output-bjam.txt>

Perhaps this failure results in on=
e failed build for JGTL and HyperNEAT
itself because i can't link to the BO=
OST_STAGE. Furthermore, when
configuring the hyperneat build, I unchecked t=
he MPI, Python and GUI
options.

The full output when building hyperneat ca=
n be found here as txt
<http://www.student.vu.nl/%7Erbk600/hyperneat/hypern=
eatFail.txt>


Any help would be greatly appreciated.
